Docs.summary:
Find all logical child elements of the specified element. This method can be chained with LINQ calls to add additional filters or projections on top of the returned results.
This method is meant to provide extra flexibility in specific scenarios and it should not be used when only the first item is being looked for. In those cases, use one of the available overloads instead, which will offer a more compact syntax as well as better performance in those cases.
Docs.returns: All the child instance from .

MemberSignature.Value: public static object FindResource (this Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement element, object resourceKey);
.method public static hidebysig object FindResource(class Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement element, object resourceKey) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function FindResource (element As FrameworkElement, resourceKey As Object) As Object
static member FindResource : Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement * obj -> obj

Docs.param: The to start searching for the target resource.
The resource key to search for.
Docs.summary:
Provides a WPF compatible version of FindResource to provide a static resource lookup. If the key is not found in the current element's resources, the logical tree is then searched element-by-element to look for the resource in each element's resources. If none of the elements contain the resource, the Application's resources are then searched.
See: .
And also: .
Docs.returns: The requested resource.
Docs.exception: Thrown when no resource is found with the specified key.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object? TryFindResource (this Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement element, object resourceKey);
.method public static hidebysig object TryFindResource(class Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement element, object resourceKey) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function TryFindResource (element As FrameworkElement, resourceKey As Object) As Object
static member TryFindResource : Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement * obj -> obj

Docs.param: The to start searching for the target resource.
The resource key to search for.
Docs.summary:
Provides a WPF compatible version of TryFindResource to provide a static resource lookup. If the key is not found in the current element's resources, the logical tree is then searched element-by-element to look for the resource in each element's resources. If none of the elements contain the resource, the Application's resources are then searched.
See: .
And also: .
Docs.returns: The requested resource, or if it wasn't found.

Docs.summary:
Provides a WPF compatible version of TryFindResource to provide a static resource lookup. If the key is not found in the current element's resources, the logical tree is then searched element-by-element to look for the resource in each element's resources. If none of the elements contain the resource, the Application's resources are then searched.
